meaningMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>raise</kanji>, and this verb is when you do that to something. It's transitive. So this means <vocabulary>to raise something</vocabulary>. It actually has a pretty wide meaning, and can also mean "raise" in the sense of <vocabulary>to cite something</vocabulary>, like an example. It can even mean <vocabulary>to hold something</vocabulary>, like an event.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as 挙がる, so if you know that reading you should know this one as well.
